name: shellhub
description: ShellHub is a self-hosted platform for managing remote shell access to Linux devices over SSH from a central web interface. It simplifies fleet access with audit logs, tags, and browser-based terminals.
features: Remote SSH access: Connect to Linux devices via SSH through a centralized web interface.
Browser terminal: Access device shells directly in the browser without SSH clients.
Device management: Organize and manage fleets of Linux devices from a single dashboard.
Session recording: Records SSH sessions for security auditing and compliance.
Tag-based filtering: Organize devices with tags for easy filtering and bulk operations.
Public key authentication: Secures device access with SSH key pairs.
Firewall rules: Control which users can access specific devices or device groups.
Session sharing: Share terminal sessions with team members for collaboration or support.
Activity logs: Tracks all connections, commands, and access attempts.
Multi-user support: Manages team access with individual accounts and permissions.
Agent deployment: Lightweight agent installs on devices to enable remote access.
API access: Automates device management and access control via REST API.
